page.title: 03INTERVIEW cont.
page.content: The following crops are grown, wheat, winter barley, spring barley,peas and sugar beet. Crop rotation exists on the farm; sheep grazing on harvested pea and sugar beet land help replenish the soil.Turnips are grown as an integral part of the rotation. Harvest is the busiest time of the year. The corn is cut and stored in driers. The problems at harvest time are if the weather is wet, the combine breaks down and the corn going too ripe and hardening. One to two weeks after harvest the corn is loaded into corn lorries using an auger. It is then sent to the corn merchants at Wootton. A normal day in harvest time would be starting work at 7.30am, service the combines until morning dew has gone. Work continues until dusk.
